fields.name: OVER_CUR_POL
fields.description: OTG2 Polarity of Overcurrent The polarity of OTG2 port overcurrent event

enumeratedValues.name: OVER_CUR_POL_0
enumeratedValues.description: High active (high on this signal represents an overcurrent condition)

enumeratedValues.name: OVER_CUR_POL_1
enumeratedValues.description: Low active (low on this signal represents an overcurrent condition)

fields.name: PWR_POL
fields.description: OTG2 Power Polarity This bit should be set according to PMIC Power Pin polarity.

enumeratedValues.name: PWR_POL_0
enumeratedValues.description: PMIC Power Pin is Low active.

enumeratedValues.name: PWR_POL_1
enumeratedValues.description: PMIC Power Pin is High active.

fields.name: WIE
fields.description: OTG2 Wake-up Interrupt Enable This bit enables or disables the OTG2 wake-up interrupt

fields.name: WKUP_ID_EN
fields.description: OTG2 Wake-up on ID change enable

fields.name: WKUP_VBUS_EN
fields.description: OTG2 wake-up on VBUS change enable

enumeratedValues.name: WKUP_DPDM_EN_0
enumeratedValues.description: DPDM changes wake-up to be disabled only when VBUS is 0.

enumeratedValues.name: WKUP_DPDM_EN_1
enumeratedValues.description: (Default) DPDM changes wake-up to be enabled, it is for device only.

fields.name: WIR
fields.description: OTG2 Wake-up Interrupt Request This bit indicates that a wake-up interrupt request is received on the OTG port

fields.name: UTMI_CLK_VLD
fields.description: Indicating whether OTG2 UTMI PHY clock is valid
